result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawntae R Dobbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions of Probation on count 1 and 2:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.

Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Count 1 -Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges.

Huber granted in the event of revocation.

Credit in the event of revocation: 2 days

Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.

Sign up for probation today

miscConds.notes:
Any and all fines, costs, surcharges, and restitution (if any ordered) to be paid directly by the Defendant to the Richland County Clerk of Court. Defendant has 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court. Failure to pay in full within 60 days or failure to stay current on an approved payment plan will result in entry of civil judgment with interest and submission of the debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue State Debt Collection (SDC) Unit.

Defendant to keep the Clerk of Court informed of any change in contact information (address and/or phone number).

records.addlTxt:
2:34 PM Defendant Shawntae R Dobbs in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Shawntae R Dobbs.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.

3:00 PM Same appearances. Attorney Zaleski states that the joint agreement is to enter a plea on count 1 and 2 for 3 years probation and 12 month jail imposed and stayed. All other counts will be dismissed. Court colloquy. Court finds a factual basis.  Defendant enters a NC plea on count 1 and 2. Closing comments.


Count 1 and 2:
Court imposes 12 months jail and stayed for 3 years of probation; concurrent to each other.

Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Count 1 -Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges.
Huber granted in the event of revocation.
Credit in the event of revocation: 2 days
Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Sign up for probation today** 

All other counts DRI.

1:00 PM Defendant Shawntae R Dobbs in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Shawntae R Dobbs.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zaleski asks for a plea and sentencing date. Attorney Zaleski states that an offer has been provide and needs to review it with his client.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:38 AM Defendant Shawnta R Dobbs not in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Shawnta R Dobbs.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zaleski states that his client has called him multiple times yesterday and SD is in La Crosse and can't get transportation. Court authorizes a warrant but stayed until the next hearing and also indicates that information hasn't been filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on July 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:41 PM Defendant Shawnta R Dobbs in court. Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Shawnta R Dobbs. Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter was set for prelim today. Defense wishes to waive the prelim. Court's colloquy with Def re prelim waiver. Waiver accepted. Bindover ordered. State will bring forth same charges as the complaint. Def pleads NG to anticipated information. State requests status in 30 days. So ordered.
Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
1:16 PM Defendant Shawntae R Dobbs in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  State makes a motion to remove the (e) from the first name (shanta) Court goes over the complaint. Defendant will have an public defender appointed to her.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:12 p.m. Def appeared by video from the Richland County Jail, represented, for this hearing only, by Atty. Lisa McDougal appearing in the courtroom. DA Jennifer Harper represented the State, appearing by video. State requests $5000 signature bond. No objection from the Defense. 5k signature bond ordered. Initial set for 1 p.m. on 5/11/22.
